title: Learner-Centered Video-Based Education Design to Strengthen Lumbar Puncture Practical Competency

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of foundational anatomy and clinical skills theory
context.additional_context: Establishing a practice environment using standardized patients and models, with video viewing capabilities via tablets and projectors

learning_goals: Learners can explain lumbar puncture procedures step-by-step with over 90% accuracy.
Learners achieve over 80% on the LumPAT assessment criteria when performing lumbar punctures in simulation environments.
Learners can list and execute at least four stages of patient safety management procedures before and after a procedure.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
